subject: Problems testing an app that uses java serialization
msgSnippet: I think this is a classloader problem but I m not sure. I m trying to test my app using junit.  My app is distributed and uses serialization to send java

I think this is a classloader problem but I'm not sure.  

I'm trying to te=
st my app using junit.  My app is distributed and uses serialization to sen=
d java objects over the wire.  When I run my tests from within Forte they w=
ork fine.  When I run them from the command line I get a InvalidClassExcept=
ion stating the serialVersionUID of my class is 0, which doesn't match the =
receiving version ID of the class.  The id of 0 makes me think that for som=
e reason my serialized classes aren't being loaded properly.  For one thing=
 I'm defining the serialVersionUID myself and it's not 0.  

My application=
 seems to work perfectly except for the class version problem so the classe=
s are being loaded at least by the VM's default class loader (and it works =
from within forte!?).

Has anyone ever seen this behaviour?

Any ideas woul=
d be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Rich
